title: VERA FILES FACT CHECK: Online post claiming Duterte will remove civil service eligibility requirement for gov’t employees FALSE
subtitle: This story is false. Don't believe it.
author: verafiles.org
vclaim:
Youtube account Tokhang TV falsely claimed that President Rodrigo Duterte will remove the civil service eligibility requirement in regularizing government employees.

In an 11-minute pirated footage posted Dec. 12, Tokhang TV wrote as headline:

The video was a segment in Radyo Pilipinas News Nationwide’s Dec. 11 broadcast. It featured a story on Duterte’s speech before military and police personnel.

The post’s claim is false on two levels.

First, the headline by Tokhang TV runs counter to the content of the video. Reporter Alvin Baltazar did not say anything about Duterte removing the eligibility requirement in “regularizing” employees.



What he said was the president would prioritize competence and trustworthiness over eligibility among those who wish to work in government:

Second, the Tokhang TV post takes the president’s speech out of context.

Duterte talked about his criteria in selecting some of his appointees in the context of corruption. He explained why he chose Lt. Gen. Macairog Alberto, commanding general of the Philippine army, and Lt. Gen. Reynaldo Mapagu, defense undersecretary for civil, veterans and retiree affairs among other appointees.

He then said:

In a report by ABS-CBN News, Civil Service Commission spokesperson Ariel Ronquillo said Duterte was only referring to his “own confidential appointees” who are not required to pass any civil service eligibility to be employed in government.

The pirated video has garnered over 27,100 views on Youtube, and could have reached at least 274,350 people more on social media. Its largest Facebook traffic generators include pages DUTERTE MARCOS SUPPORTERS; HARRY ROQUE, BONG GO AT RONALD “BATO” DELA ROSA - DDS PARA SA SENADO; and Federal for Better Philippines.

Tokhang TV, which has a history of posting false and misleading reports, was created in November 2016.
